meanings.definition: An instrument for recording time intervals with great accuracy.
meanings.sent1: My dad's old chronographs helped him time his running races precisely.
meanings.sent2: The new chronographs in the store window looked sleek and modern.
meanings.sent3: The chronographs at the science fair were so accurate, they even timed the ants racing.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like chronographs, capturing every moment with precision.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the chronographs ticking filled the room, marking each passing second.

meanings.definition: A watch or clock with a built-in stopwatch function.
meanings.sent1: I used my chronographs to time how long it took me to run around the block.
meanings.sent2: The chronographs on his wrist beeped as he completed his laps around the track.
meanings.sent3: The chronographs on sale were so popular that they sold out within hours.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat like a chronographs, measuring the moments of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The chronographs on the wall displayed the time in bold, digital numbers.
